author: chuck_hampton
post: I met privately with Dr. Herbert Haas of SMU while viewing a life size transparency at the Biblical Arts Museum in Dallas back in 1990. As a C 14 expert he was appalled at the 1988 fiasco and said the most useful sample would be a single thread running the length of the Shroud just off image. He said hundreds of dates could be obtained along with the measure of other isotopes of different elements like Oxygen, etc which could provide a plethora of data on the “event” of image formation while at the same time leaving no visible mark on the cloth..
title: Carbon Date the Shroud Again?
